content:
We have not haven conference call for the last three weeks due to Sydney WGM and US holiday. If you have any agenda items you would like to discuss on Monday (Feb 24th)'s conference all, please bring it up. So far, we have one item:

  • Moving FHIR Shorthand project to ballot.
Should we review some of the discussions on messaging (e.g. messaging vs. subscription)? @Eric Haas
Yes... INM is reviewing this as well.
Agenda for 3/23 FHIR-I call. I know @Brett Marquard want to talk about MedMorph PSS. Is there any other specific topic or JIRA ticket should be discussed on Monday?

Agenda for 3/30 FHIR-I call:

  1. FSH ready for ballot vote @Mark Kramer
    If there are other topics need to be discussed in 3/30 FHIR-I call, please add to this thread. Thanks
I just want to give a heads-up if anyone hasn't seen the FHIR Shorthand ballot material that will be voted on Monday: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-shorthand/

Agenda for 4/13 FHIR-I Call:

  • Block vote for 47 track items
  • J#25474

If there are other topics need to be discussed, please add here. Thanks.
I'm waiting for FHIR-I's feedback for https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-25474 - the status of the item keeps bugging me for feedback, but I've already done that. The ball is in your court for now...
@René Spronk You need to click the "Provide requested info" button...
Done. If someone asks me a question, I respond. But "responding" doesn't involve that specific button...
Jira has its own idea of how you should be working :-)
@René Spronk I added that ticket to our agenda.
If you have a better idea for the name, that's doable, but Jira functions by pushing buttons. It has no way of knowing whether a given comment provides an answer.

Agenda for upcoming conference call (Apr 20, Monday):

  • Block Vote https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179280-fhir.2Finfrastructure-wg/topic/FHIR-I.20Block.20Vote

If there's other topics need to be discussed, please reply here

For next week, we'd like to add a topic to the agenda on Subscription. Goal is for us to agree on merging the changes that @Gino Canessa has in a branch at http://build.fhir.org/branches/argonaut-subscription/subscription (this implements the approach we proposed last time around). We don't need it to be perfect, but getting this chunk in place will help with refinements downstream.

Agenda for Monday (May 4th) FHIR-I conference call is published here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Minutes+CC+20200504

  • Tracker FHIR-25398
  • Review FHIR-I project status (action item from last week)
For next Monday's call, would like to talk through FHIR#27083, which boils down to "can we unify Group and List" (from @Drew Torres)
I'm not sure whether I can make tomorrow's call, but I've posted my thoughts.
We need to discuss closing project 1104 (SDC) and 1265 (DAF) .
Also for today: discuss Granular Data + Bulk Data project, to make sure our continued work falls under existing PSSs.
@Lloyd McKenzie you took our meeting with you :/
Gotomeeting ended when you left.
I also skyped him
Lloyd only thinks we can meet when he is available. :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
He's restarting it -- stand by
(I think he needs to reboot his computer first.)
And we'r eback!

Can we get these on the list for Monday's discussion? They're all related to the Subscription track:
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27130
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27129
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27131
http://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27138
http://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27141
http://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27142
http://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27143
http://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27148
http://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27149

cc @Gino Canessa

(For Monday, May 18th)
Edit: out of curiosity, why are half of your links https and half http? :-)
Hrm. This is a good question.
Looks like the FHIR#... may create http, and I just copied those from zulip
The others were copied straight from the browser url
Interesting. I was curious because of the alignment :-)
I'm signing off, so have a great weekend!
No problem @Jenni Syed
@Josh Mandel Do you plan to bring FHIR#27083 to vote on this coming Monday?
Yes as long as @Lloyd McKenzie and @Drew Torres can join
Monday == Memorial Day? @Yunwei Wang @Josh Mandel ? Or a different day?

FHIR never rests
:eyes: :alarm_clock:
Arrr. Constantly forgot that.
I forgot too. next Monday, not this coming Monday.
@Josh Mandel Is that a block vote? If so, can you post all the related JIRA tickets here (or a new thread for subscription block vote)?
Is what a block vote?
Oh I think Gino realized that the older subscription issues had already been voted on, and just need to be marked as "applied"
Got it. So only FHIR#27083 need to be voted on next Monday (which is June 1st).
I'm seriously hoping the next Monday isn't yet July...
(If it was, I was going to complain about skipping a U.S. holiday and postponing the topic to a Canadian holiday :) )

Agenda for June 8th:

  • FSH block vote #1 (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179280-fhir.2Finfrastructure-wg/topic/Proposed.20FSH.20Block.20Vote.20.231)

Agenda for Jun 22nd:

  • Argonaut Granular Controls PSS (@Brett Marquard )
  • J#27810 (@David Pyke )
  • J#27809 (@David Pyke )
adding one agenda item for Jun 22nd: FSH block vote #2 (@Mark Kramer )

Agenda for WG Call on Monday (June 29th):

  • FHIR Shorthand Block Vote #3 (@Mark Kramer )
@Yunwei Wang we didn't get to the FSH vote yesterday. Can you add Block Vote #3 to the July 6 agenda? Thanks

Agenda for WG call on Monday (July 6th)

  • FHIR Shorthand Block Vote #4 (@Mark Kramer )

Agenda for Monday 2020-July-20:

  • Moving to Zoom @Lloyd McKenzie
For the record, I'm officially okay with it (they have a working Linux + web solution now)
PSS for Subscriptions R4 backport IG
This major showstopping Issue with Validation Error in US Core Errata Edition
Also, our plans/objectives for the WGM - do we want any joints?

Note that the meeting announcement has Zoom call information. Since it is officially scheduled for 1 hour, I don't know if Zoom would cut out after an hour... Here is the information in case someone needs it:

Webmeeting Info:
https://zoom.us/j/8583747934

Notes:
Audio will be through the Zoom connection, NOT the HL7 dial-in number. Some calls may last less than the full 2 hours, depending on the volume of outstanding issues. Minutes of past calls can be found here: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=40743450 Alternate phone numbers: +1 312 626 6799 US (Chicago), +1 346 248 7799 US (Houston), +1 646 558 8656 US (New York), +1 669 900 9128 US (San Jose), +1 253 215 8782 US (Tacoma), +1 301 715 8592 US (Germantown) - Find your local number: https://zoom.us/u/adCSJORbR4
Agenda item is finalized: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Minutes+CC+20200720.
